descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Legal_St 276 "The American Revolution" Spring 2016


The American Revolution changed the lives of all of the people living on the North American continent, not just those who rebelled against Britain or volunteered to fight. For women, American Indians, enslaved people, loyalists, poor whites and elite colonists alike, the war changed everything. This course examines the causes and consequences of the war from a variety of historical perspectives, focusing on how ideas of liberty and freedom resonated?or did not resonate?in the lived experience of North Americans caught up in the Revolution.
